Course Title: Handful of Leaves Learning and Practice Resources
Lessons: lesson-section-break-the-handful-of-leaves-model; introduction-to-the-handful-of-leaves-model; hol-elements-of-the-handful-of-leaves; hol-section-break-guiding-aspirations-category; handful-of-leaves-guiding-aspirations; handful-of-leaves-aspiration-for-awakening; handful-of-leaves-bodhisattva-vows; handful-of-leaves-cultivating-bodhicitta-meditation; handful-of-leaves-great-wisdom; hol-great-compassion; hol-great-action; hol-well-being-for-self-and-others; hol-liberation-nibbana; hol-section-break-path-as-refuge; hol-taking-refuge---a-guide-to-the-three-jewels
Subheading: Deepening our Understanding and Practice with the Essential Dharma.
Main Content / Description:
The following resources support the Handful of Leaves Learning and Practice Resources, specifically designed for the Essential Dharma Study Group sessions held on Thursday mornings (9:30 am - 10:30 am). These materials are intended to assist you in deepening your understanding and practice of ‘The Handful of Leaves Model.’

To access the current materials for the course you are interested in, please scroll down to locate the relevant section.

We greatly value your participation in these sessions and the associated community groups, as well as your companionship on this shared path.

The Dharma is deep and profound. It can help us live with greater well-being, happiness, wisdom, compassion, wakefulness, and freedom.

As wonderful as the Dharma is, it can be challenging to integrate what is discovered in our meditation practice into our daily mindful living practice. There are many ways to apply Mindfulness in daily life.

‍

Lessons: satipatthana-sutta; satipatthana-sutta-mindfulness-of-breathing; satipatthana-sutta-bodily-postures; satipatthana-sutta-bodily-activities; satipatthana-sutta-parts-of-the-body; satipatthana-sutta-four-elements; satipatthana-sutta-impermanence-of-the-body; satipatthana-sutta-feelings; satipatthana-sutta-mind-states; satipatthana-sutta-dhammas-five-hindrances; satipatthana-sutta-dhammas-five-aggregates; satipatthana-sutta-dhammas-the-six-sense-spheres; satipatthana-sutta-dhammas-seven-factors-of-awakening; satipatthana-sutta-dhammas-four-noble-truths
Main Content / Description: The Four Foundations of Mindfulness (Satipatthana Sutta) is one of the most influential teachings for establishing mindfulness. Here, Jesse Foy offers a version that has been slightly modified for the modern student. You're invited to listen to the full version or explore whatever section is relevant to your practice.
The following lessons and meditations are offered to support your practice and learning as participate in this 6-week course.
